author: Nandini Makkar
title: Noah Lyles' Biggest Flaw to His World Record Beating Ambition Revealed - EssentiallySports
text:
Noah Lyles is one of the sprint athletes who etched close to the topmost benchmark established by Usain Bolt in the 100m run by clinching a 9.83 seconds record in comparison to Bolt’s 9.58. However, some recent revelations of this year’s anticipated world record athlete called attention to his biggest flaws in return. Amidst all disclosures, Usain Bolt too, is of a belief that Noah Lyles can be one of the contenders to break the world record this time in the Paris Olympics 2024. While Noah Lyles comprises the same dynamism as Usain Bolt, to win in the Summer Olympics this time, he hopes to etch his name in both 100m and 200m, surpassing the record that was formerly Usain Bolt’s.
Noah Lyles’ biggest mistake that could hinder his way to success ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
Underestimating the rest, Noah Lyles, according to Rodney Green explained Usain Bolt’s view in a recent interview by Ready Set Go in a YouTube Podcast. He said that the 8X Olympic gold medalist had explained, “He (Noah Lyles) often underestimates the rounds of the 100m, in comparison to the 200m.” Though he added that the possibilities are in favor of the 200, it’s stacked up against him in the 100.

The host also declared that it has been only Usain Bolt who has taken up gold medals for both 100 and 200m, however, it looks dicey that both could be cliched at a time when an athlete is full of sanguinity. “Now, he (Noah Lyles) didn’t say anything about the 100, I know he said it about the 200, but those rounds in that 100 were going to take out a lot on his body” added Gatlin.
Sighting the Paris Olympics 2024 Difficult to breakthrough the ongoing legacy of the Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt, Noah Lyles aims to go past Usain Bolt’s 2009 world record in the 200m of 19.19s. Confident to achieve his goal this time, he sights his eyes on the 2024 Paris Olympics this season . Not to forget, in his recent interview with the CNN Sports, Noah Lyles had said, “ We worked on the 60 to help my 100 and my 200 and we’ve seen major progression in that. ”

Aiming to expand his athletic portfolio, Noah Lyles’s goal is to compete for four golds this season – 100m, 200m, 4x100m , and 4x400m races, a record which even Usain Bolt didn’t ever achieve during the same event. “ He was the fastest man ever to do it, and soon, it’ll be me.” , the American sprinter exclaimed with a sarcastic grin on his face,

author: Torocuervo
title: #48 Un atentado islamista durante la misa de Navidad deja más de 160 cristianos asesinados en Nigeria
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#0](c0#c-0) Ese titular es tendencioso y confuso, y probablemente seas consciente. El ataque no fue durante una misa, como quiere dar a entender, si no que se atacó una serie de aldeas de manera coordinada. Y además, el factor religioso no es el único relevante, y tampoco está plenamente confirmado.
Hay fuentes mucho más serias, informadas y rigurosas que la que has mandado...
[#10](c10#c-10) Resulta difícil creer que puedan existir fuentes más serias leyendo maravillas cosas como:
La reciente matanza sucedida en Navidad confirma lo que anuncian las estadísticas: el cristianismo es la religión más perseguida en el mundo. Y no se limita solamente a esta región de África, sino que ocurre en Asia y Medio Oriente. Hace poco a cristianos perseguidos por el régimen comunista chino se les negó asilo en la España de Pedro Sánchez y el PSOE. Solo una lo pudo obtener porque su salud le impedía subir al avión donde la deportaban.
Todo ello, mientras las pateras siguen llegando a España, posiblemente con insurgentes tan radicales como los que masacran a los cristianos en Nigeria y sin el amparo para los cristianos que huyen de estos.
[#9](c9#c-9) bueno. Entérate quién financio al valeroso pueblo de Afganistán y sus valerosos guerreros los muyahidines( les dedicaron Rambo iii y todo), o quien armó y financio a Irak, a estos que ves ahora este terrible atentado de la noticia, quien los organizo y financió, ... Después nos vuelves a contar estás cosas. Y si sigues pensando que está irán detrás de todo pq es omnipresente vale. Si ves q algún otro estado puede estar implicado, fijate quién lo arma y financia. Un saludo.
[#13](c13#c-13) lo se y lo he criticado 100 millones de veces, dinero de EEUU y Arabia Saudita y Pakistán.
Pero eso no les importa para llamarlos partisanos, "que en Europa les habría llamado partisanos y que habrían luchado contra los nazis"
Eso es mierda, el fanatismo religioso no atiende a razones.
Al menos tu comentario muestra algo de vergüenza de esa gente... Algo es algo.
[#20](c20#c-20) pues mira otra vez la captura que mandas, pq es exactamente lo que estoy diciendo. Afganistán era un país más adelantado que España y las mujeres iban sin velo. El tío Sam puso a la derecha religiosa conservadora, o lo que viene a ser los fascistas de toda la vida, pero en musulmán, a levantarse en armas... Cómo en Irak, libia, Egipto, Ucrania... Mismo proceder en todos lados, mismo resultado en todos lados. Países de mierda con gobiernos autoritarios y la población paupérrima y reprimida. Eso es el tío Sam.
[#30](c30#c-30) Claro, Afganistan era un paraiso...
https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guerra_de_Afganist%C3%A1n_(1978-1992))
Tienes una vision de la historia bastante distorsionada. China tambien dio armas a los talibanes para luchar contra la URSS, entre otros tantos paises....
Claaaaaaro, todo culpa del tio sam...
[#31](c31#c-31) entérate lo que era Afganistán antes del 92.
Era un estado laico. En el año 90 la mayoría del profesorado eran mujeres, por ejemplo, que estaba integrada en el mundo laboral.
Y la revolución hostigada por el tío Sam puso a los integristas islámicos. Los valerosos muyahidines, como dijeron en Rambo 3, que les dedicaron.
Infórmate tú un poquito, antes de hablar sin saber.
[#32](c32#c-32) tengo entendido dos cosas : Rambo III estaba dedicada a “the galant people of Afghanistan” , lo otro es un bulo . Pero la info en internet se contradice en todas partes acerca de esto , asi que no sé.
Segundo:
Lo de que Afghanistan era laico , mujeres sin velo etc . se ha mostrado erróneo, solo era en Khabul . En las zonas agrarias (el resto del país) era anticuado respecto a esto .
Pero es un lío y al final no sabes lo que es verdad o no , internet está lleno de información contradictoria .
Mira, igual en que en Gaza, pero estos no lo llaman masacre.
https://www.lavanguardia.com/internacional/20231217/9456963/iglesia-denuncia-israel-mato-sangre-fria-dos-feligresas-gaza.html
https://es.zenit.org/2023/12/12/22-cristianos-muertos-en-gaza-cohete-sin-detonar-hallado-en-parroquia/
[#9](c9#c-9) ¿En qué parte de su comentario dice eso? "no son culpables de sus actos" y toda la mierda que sigue. O qué parte de su comentario te ha llevado a esa conclusión, si es que necesitas algo más de margen.
Aunque es posible que esa respuesta no tenga nada que ver con su comentario y simplemente sea una patética y lamentable pataleta porque no te ha gustado su respuesta.
[#17](c17#c-17) "por no sé que historia".
¿O por "no quiero saber"? Te dan la oportunidad de aprender, no la desperdicies.
[#19](c19#c-19) tienes algún comentario de crítica o de repudio a esta atrocidad? O vienes aquí a adoctrinar me sobre lo malo que es eeuu?
Es una noticia de 160 muertos a manos de yihadistas por ser infieles.
Entre tu y yo? Es duro entrar aquí a un noticia tan trágica y ponerte a discutir sobre si la culpa es o no es de occidente o ya estás curado de eso?
Entras aquí a recalcar que "no quiero saber" tu verdad... Que ascazo.
[#21](c21#c-21) Eres tú quien ha introducido este tema. Igual esperabas otro tipo de respuestas y ahora te arrepientes de haberte puesto a chapotear con intención de salpicar a los demás.
[#23](c23#c-23) en todo momento denunció:
1* las atrocidades de grupos islamistas radicales, no como tantos aquí que aprendieron que eran los talibanes hace 2 meses y ahora los llaman partisanos. Asesinos es su nombre, como es el del gobierno de irán o Arabia Saudita ente otros.
2* crítico a los que claramente ocultan y defienden a estos asesinos bajo un pretexto de victimismo en Palestina.
Un terrorista es un terrorista y lo es con 0 muertos en Palestina y con un millón de muertos.
[#27](c27#c-27) 1a parte todo bien. Segunda, ya no tanto ¿Cómo que terrorista se es y punto?
¿Crees de verdad que si a esta gente nadie estuviera tocándole los huevos en su casa harían lo mismo?
Ir a la raíz del problema, a las causas, e intentar desenredar un tema complejo no es defender a nadie.
[#14](c14#c-14) Yo no apoyo yihadistas, eso es Israel que apoya a DAESH
Yo soy de izquierdas, no apoyo a la extrema derecha
No es muy dificil de entender, ánimo
[#18](c18#c-18) otro comentario más de "la culpa es de todos menos de la yihad y los países de mierda donde reina la sharia"
Hoy te estás coronado máquina.
Que lastima que estes aquí criticando a occidente para tapar mierdas de asesinos fanatizados y no allí al revés como los verdaderos mártires que si luchan por denunciar atrocidades de países islámicos, ahí veríamos lo valiente que eres con tu reinvidicacion de sofa y tu bandera nazi con la israelí en la foto de perfil.
[#25](c25#c-25) Financiasteis a los talibanes para combatir a los rusos y ahora estamos pagando los platos
Financiar ISIS para destruir oriente medio
Financiar siempre lo peor para seguir con los genocidios, apartheid, limpieza étnica...
[#26](c26#c-26) "Financiasteis a los talibanes"
yo no financie a nadie, manipulador de pacotilla. Típico de esos de la bandera de tu perfil.
Muestras muchos decíamos que la primavera árabe está plagado de fanáticos religiosos que apoyaban las reveliones, tantos otros decían que "callate, hacen lo que deberíamos estar haciendo en Europa, es una revolución". Ahora a gente como tú, si tu, que estás criticando a los críticos con el yihadismo de hamas se le avisa que apoyar grupos terroristas que hacen matanzas públicas es una barbaridad y que esto les embalentona y atrae a más fanáticos y que será la perdición de Palestina no escucháis. Dentro de 10 años saldrán muchos de Europa que han visto gritos de Allahu adbak y tontos en Internet diciendo que el único error de hamas es no haber actuado antes... Luego habrán chavales que pensarán que están siendo héroes en un Isis o unos talibanes dando su vida por puercos que vienen a cuerpo de rey con 4 mujeres y esclavas sexuales.
[#18](c18#c-18) para tí seguro que extrema derecha es alguien de izquierdas que no compre el pack correntista de turno.
Estos son los que en Francia, España e Italia eran llamados partisanos por que no se que mierdas de las circunstancias? O estos los podemos llamar terroristas?
La yihad se lleva a cabo con muerte de infieles y el miedo a serlo.
No se trata de liberar nada, cada ataque sirve para atraer radicales y causar estragos en los no creyetes.
Quien apoya a yihadistas es tan asesino como ellos.
[#3](c3#c-3) Estos son los que llevan EEUU y UK financiando más de un siglo
A lo más fundamentalista y extremista
Aquí cuando iban a la casa blanca a recibir paguitas
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archivo:Reagan_sitting_with_people_from_the_Afghanistan-Pakistan_region_in_February_1983.jpg
[#8](c8#c-8) bajo ninguna circunstancia son culpables de sus actos, siempre es otro, la culpa siempre será de EEUU, de UK, de la sociedad, de la Bernarda, pero nunca ellos y su fanatismo religioso serán los culpables para vosotros.
Vuestra fijación por defender o tapar cada asesino terrorista con escusas es repugnante y os rebaja como... Voy a decir seres humanos.
Es decir para vosotros el fanatismo islámico viene de un supuesto apoyo de EEUU a hamas y no de irán...
Boko haram es un paso de baile radicalizado por EEUU.
Los talibanes son partisanos radicalizados por EEUU.
Los hermanos musulmanes se radicalizado jugando call of duty.
Pero jamás lobbys, poderes y dinero de países radicales apoyan a estos grupos de mierda.
Así es vuestro mundo.
[#12](c12#c-12) pero si tu pecas de lo mismo.
A quien coño quieres dar lecciones?
EEUU: apoyo yihadistas para quitarse de en medio a un enemigo común.
Tu: apoyas yihadistas para quitarte de en medio un enemigo común.
Eso que tienes ahí llamando nazis es la bandera de Israel no? Imagino que no eres simpatizante, pues eso.
La única deferencia entre EEUU y vosotros es que a EEUU sólo le movía la política, a vosotros os pierde el fanatismo.
Sabes lo que más me revienta de vosotros? Que no vais a ser vosotros quien caiga en esa oscuridad por vuestra culpa.
Habrá niños de 15 que se sentirán libertadores, partisanos, defensores poniendo bombas para un estado islámico por vuestra culpa y vuestros comentarios.
[#8](c8#c-8) Reagan murió hace 20 años y dejó la presidencia hace 35... De verdad tu argumento más solido es usar una foto de hace 40 años? Alguna prueba que adjuntar a la afirmación de la financiación de EEUU y UK a los culpables de este atentado?
Acaso guarda alguna relación Reagan reuniéndose con los muyahidines hace 40 años con este atentado en Nigeria y yo no me he enterado?
Aquí cuando iban a la casa blanca a recibir paguitas
Estos terroristas de Nigeria? Un pelín racista por tu parte hacer un batiburrillo basándote únicamente en que son integristas musulmanes.

author: 三立新聞網
title: 高雄凌晨586戶停電原因曝！管破淹成小河…台電線路「浸泡水中」等抽乾
text:
記者陳弘逸／高雄報導
▲台電管線疑有水管遭到挖損，導致現場嚴重積水，須待水抽乾以後，才能進一步查明受損情況。（圖／台電提供）
高雄市前金區中華三路、大同二路、文武二街及自強二路等附近一帶，今天（3日）凌晨，發生停電，共造成附近586戶受影響；台電獲報，於半小時左右恢復供電；經查，疑管線單位施工拉到台電線路，導致停電，但現場疑有水管遭到挖損，導致現場嚴重積水，須待水抽乾以後，才能進一步查明受損情況。
▲高雄市前金區今天（3日）凌晨，發生停電，共造成附近586戶受影響。（圖／台電提供）
台電說明，今天（3日）凌晨2時13分前金區中華三路、大同二路、文武二街及自強二路等附近一帶不明原因停電，造成586戶受影響。
經台電人員派員搶修，於2時44分隔離事故點後，恢復全數供電；初步勘查，其他管線單位施工拉到台電管線，至於受損線路位置及受損狀況，因損壞位置疑有水管遭到挖損，導致現場嚴重積水，須待水抽乾以後，才能進一步釐清。

更多新聞： 連3天都來亂！中國解放軍戰機、軍艦「逾越海峽中線」遶台灣一圈路線曝

author: Michael
title: Review on Obsession Love Spells from Warlock Magic Spells - itechfy
text: Never in my life did I think that I would even consider having a love spell cast, let alone pay for it to be done professionally. My view changed on this when my cousin went through a terrible divorce. Her husband left her for another woman and it was devastating to her. She was caught off guard with this affair and did not realize it was going on for an entire year before she found out. My cousin wanted to work things out with her husband, but he never gave her the chance to do so which was extra hurtful. This resulted in her seeking out the advice of psychics which lead her to having an obsession spell cast. She never told anyone that she hired a spell caster to help get her husband back until after they reconciled. The end result of that whole situation was that her husband ended his affair and decided that he wanted to work on their marriage. He became very attracted to her like how it was when they first met. When she told me this I was floored! I didn’t think that things like this actually worked for people. It got me thinking about a boyfriend that I had years prior. If she could have an obsession spell cast to bring her husband back, I wonder if I could manifest bringing my ex-boyfriend back too. This was a relationship that went sour fast. A mutual friend of ours introduced us. He was going through a long term break up at the time and wasn’t ready to date. I knew this and intended on taking it slow, but when we were together in person neither of us could deny the chemistry we both felt. The relationship was passionate, however when we were apart, I felt a distance from him that caused everything to become off balance. It was like a yoyo relationship where we got close and then he pushed me away. This happened over and over again. I started to feel extremely hurt and lonely. My love for him grew immensely while he pushed me away. I finally gave up and stopped trying to spend time with him. About two years later when my cousin had her experience with her husband leaving her and then coming back the thought of my ex popped into my mind. I wondered if an [obsession spell](https://www.warlockmagicspells.com/obsession-love-spells) would help me too. I had nothing to lose. I contacted Warlock Magic Spells and had them cast an obsession love spell to bring my ex back. I waited about three months and then out of the blue I received a text from him. I almost fell off my chair when I read it! We began talking and catching up. He told me that he started having dreams about me and missed me. He said that I was the best one he dated, and he had regrets about letting me go. This time around, I took it slow because I did not want to get hurt again. To say he was a changed man was an understatement. He put more effort into pursuing me than he ever did in the past. He made me feel special and wanted. He was more emotionally available and made his feelings known. It was a completely different relationship this time around. I could tell that he was in love with me. I have to say that my obsession spell worked well!

author: VNExplorer
title: Biden Accelerates U.S. Automakers Shift to EVs With $1.7B Conversion Grants
text: U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm returned to her former home state of Michigan on Thursday to tour one of the 11 automaker facilities that her department awarded a total of $1.7 billion in electric vehicle "conversion grants." The DOE grants are the latest part of the Biden administration's multi-billion-dollar effort to shift struggling U.S. facilities to EV production. Granholm toured a General Motors facility in Lansing, Michigan, that won the largest of the grants, a $500 million award to convert its Lansing Grand River Assembly Plant to make EVs. Granholm spent more than a decade in Lansing as Michigan's governor and attorney general, and she said she had seen the state suffer as GM and Detroit's other automakers lost jobs to foreign competition. "For so long we acted as if the best days of American manufacturing were behind us and that there was nothing we could do about it," Granholm said in a press briefing on Wednesday, previewing the grant announcements. Other countries had vigorous government programs supporting their auto sectors, Granholm argued. Now the U.S. has one as well, she said, with President Joe Biden's approach that melds industrial strategy with climate policy to grow manufacturing jobs while cutting greenhouse gas emissions. "We're giving American manufacturing a chance to get off the sidelines and back in the competition," she said. The Domestic Auto Manufacturing Conversion Grants program is a competitive process funded by the Inflation Reduction Act, or IRA, to help prevent the possible closure of auto facilities and instead shift them to electric production. The grants announced Thursday support facilities in eight states making a range of electric, hybrid and hydrogen fuel cell cars, trucks, buses and even motorcycles. White House officials said the winning facilities are ones that were at risk of closure or cutbacks or, in some cases, had already been shuttered and will now reopen. Global EV sales have grown rapidly but many traditional U.S. automakers have struggled to switch from internal combustion engine vehicles to electric, raising concerns that cheaper foreign-made EVs, especially from Chinese automakers, would dominate the new market. "Funding the EV transition is compelling traditional automakers to invest vastly more each year than they did in a stable, internal combustion engine world, seriously challenging their profitability," economist Elaine Buckberg told Newsweek. Buckberg is a senior fellow at the Salata Institute for Climate and Sustainability at Harvard University and was formerly chief economist of General Motors. "Being selected for one of these grants is a huge benefit for the winning company and community," Buckberg said. Accelerating EV Investments The grants are the latest move by the Biden administration to support domestic EV construction while clamping down on carbon pollution from gas-powered vehicles. The administration's limits on tailpipe emissions from cars and trucks, announced in March, are the most stringent in history—yet they won support from several major automakers and trade groups. In May, Biden announced steep tariffs on Chinese EVs and batteries, and tax incentives in the IRA encourage sales of domestic EVs and corporate investment in EV construction and battery facilities in the U.S. According to the White House, the private sector has invested $177 billion in EV and battery manufacturing nationwide since Biden took office. An analysis published in March by the nonprofit Environmental Defense Fund found that companies had invested $114 billion in EV and battery manufacturing just since the passage of the IRA, roughly three times what had been invested in the five years before Biden took office. GM officials said in a statement that the company has announced over $12 billion in investments for EV manufacturing and supply chains since 2020. General Motors won a $500 million grant from the Department of Energy to convert its Lansing, Michigan, facility to EV production. John F. Martin/Courtesy of GM "GM's investment and this Department of Energy grant underscore our commitment to U.S. leadership in manufacturing and innovation, making sure we're competitive at home and abroad," GM Vice President of North America Manufacturing and Labor Relations Camilo Ballesty said in a statement. GM appears on both Newsweek's rankings of America's Most Responsible Companies and Most Trustworthy Companies in America. Three other grant recipients also appear on Newsweek rankings of responsible and trustworthy companies. Iconic motorcycle maker Harley-Davidson, which appears in the top ten among the automotive sector in both of those Newsweek rankings, won $89 million from the DOE to expand its York, Pennsylvania, facility to make the LiveWire EV motorcycle. Auto parts supplier Cummins, on the list of America's Most Responsible Companies, will use its $75 million grant to convert a facility in Columbus, Indiana, to make zero-emissions components and electric powertrain systems. And Georgia-based Blue Bird, which appears on Newsweek's Most Trustworthy Companies in America ranking, won nearly $80 million to convert a facility to make zero-emission electric school buses and expand its workforce training. Blue Bird has quietly become the country's best-performing EV company with stock prices more than doubling in the first half of this year, thanks in part to the Biden administration's EV push. In a recent profile interview with Newsweek, Blue Bird President Briton Smith said the company benefitted from about $200 million in additional revenue in 2022 because of government policy support. "We've seen really an exponential growth in applications and number of school districts across the country," Smith told Newsweek in June, singling out the impact of the federal Clean School Bus program to help school districts switch from polluting diesel buses. "This additional funding has really helped increase the interest across the country," Smith said. Other grant recipients include American Autoparts Inc., in Toledo, Ohio; two grants are going to Fiat-Chrysler for facilities in Belvidere, Illinois, and Kokomo, Indiana; Volvo for its heavy truck facilities in the U.S.; and Michigan-based autoparts maker ZF North America. Supporting Union Jobs Blue Bird stands out as the only grant recipient based in a southern state. Not coincidentally, Blue Bird is also among just a few southern automaking facilities with a unionized workforce. Blue Bird workers voted last year to join the United Steelworkers of America and the company finalized its first contract with the union this year. Workers at Blue Bird voted in 2023 to join the United Steelworkers of America and in May the union and company agreed to a contract raising wages and benefits. Courtesy of Blue Bird All 11 facilities receiving grants are unionized and when previewing the grant awards for reporters, Biden administration officials made clear the importance of unions to a workforce. "We will not let our transition to clean energy be a zero-sum game where workers get left behind," Acting Labor Secretary Julie Su said in the Wednesday press briefing. White House officials projected that the grants would help ensure 15,000 union jobs and spur creation of 2,900 new jobs. Su said the grants are not "blank checks" and that companies will be held accountable for commitments to production and job retention and creation. The DOE will negotiate terms for the funding including milestones for production schedules, the timeline for reactivating closed facilities in some cases, and targets for training and re-skilling workers. The United Auto Workers, which endorsed President Biden's reelection campaign after he joined UAW workers on a picket line during their strike last fall, is a winner in the grants. At least five of the grants awarded create or retain UAW jobs. "We've said all along that the money is there to make this a just transition, and not a race to the bottom," the UAW said in a statement emailed to Newsweek. "We're excited to be fighting alongside the Department of Energy to make sure that corporations that get federal funding honor their commitments to the workers who make the products." Start your unlimited Newsweek trial

author: Victoria Garcia
title: Amazon's AirPods Pro deal cuts their price to $189
text:
Simon Cohen / Digital Trends Not into the over-the-ear headphones trend that is going on right now? Don’t worry, you won’t have to sacrifice your in-ear headphones anytime soon with this AirPods deal we just found. Right now on Amazon, you can save 24% on the Apple AirPods Pro by paying only $189 for these popular headphones. With an original price of $250, this is a deal you can’t miss out on.
Why you should buy the Apple AirPods Pro If noise-cancelling and deep immersive sound are two must-have features when it comes to purchasing your new headphones, then you don’t need to look any further than the Apple AirPods Pro. These wireless headphones offer two different modes to give you an easy listening experience. Transparency mode allows you to hear the world around you and Adaptive Audio blends together active noise cancellation and Transparency Mode to give you the best listening experience no matter where you are.
The Apple AirPods Pro have been compared to other brands such as Samsung and Google , but always seem to come out on top in terms of comfort, quality and sound. They are sweat, water and dust resistant, so you can use them in just about any scenario. These are great for taking phone calls (even in windy and loud conditions) and listening to anything from music, podcasts, audiobooks, television shows or movies. They offer a compact and comfortable look and feel that will change the way you listen. Our editor suggests buying these headphones for a true noise-cancelling and wireless experience. The Apple AirPods Pro “adopt an in-ear design which has them seal up the entrance to the ear canal and broadcast sound straight down the hallway to your eardrum. This seal is essential for blocking out noise and, as a bonus, delivers better bass response.”
Related Best Beats headphone deals: Save on Studio Pro, Studio Buds This 75-inch 4K TV just had its price slashed from $800 to $540 Best after-Christmas TV deals: Samsung, LG, Sony, Vizio, and more For those looking for all-around reliable and true noise-cancelling headphones, the Apple Airpods Pro are a must. This product includes four pairs of silicone tips in four different sizes, that will fit a wide range of ears so you will never have to worry about comfort. Grab these wireless headphones for $189 before time runs out. That’s 24% off their normal price of $250!
